1.title: The City of the Dead
1.plot: Features the horror classic "The City of the Dead", aka "Horror Hotel". Learn more about the film and about the show's host, Lamia - The Queen of the Dark.

2.title: Carnival of Souls
2.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

4.title: Grave of the Vampire
4.plot: Lamia talks about the 1972 vampire film "Grave of the Vampire" before showing you the film.

5.title: Moon of the Wolf
5.plot: This episode features the 1972 horror film "Moon of the Wolf" and an interview with Bill Oberst, Jr.

6.title: King of the Zombies
6.plot: This episode features 1941's "King of the Zombies", interviews with Scout Taylor-Compton and Tony Todd, and footage from The 2013 Horror Hotel Scream Queen Competition.

7.title: The Terror
7.plot: This episode features Roger Corman's 1963 horror film "The Terror".

8.title: House on Haunted Hill
8.plot: This episode features the original "House on Haunted Hill" and an interview with Shriekfest director Denise Gossett.

9.title: Satan's School for Girls
9.plot: This episode features the original horror movie "Satan's School for Girls" from 1973.

10.title: Atom Age Vampire
10.plot: Features the 1960 film "Atom Age Vampire" (aka Seddok, l'erede di Satana).

11.title: Dementia 13
11.plot: This episode features the 1963 Francis Ford Coppola directorial debut "Dementia 13" and an interview with Alex Vincent.

12.title: The Ape
12.plot: This episode features the 1940 classic horror film "The Ape", interviews with filmmaker Jason Tostevin and writer Randall Greenland, and footage from The 2014 International Horror Hotel's scream queen competition.

13.title: White Zombie
13.plot: Features 1932's "White Zombie", and an interview with director Gary Jones.

14.title: Last Woman on Earth
14.plot: Features 1960's "Last Woman on Earth" and an interview with composer Darshan Shah.

15.title: Silent Night, Bloody Night
15.plot: Features the 1972 horror film "Silent Night, Bloody Night".

1.title: Horror Express
1.plot: Features the 1972 Christopher Lee/Peter Cushing film "Horror Express".

2.title: One Body Too Many
2.plot: Features the 1944 horror comedy "One Body Too Many".

3.title: The Amazing Mr. X
3.plot: This episode features the 1948 thriller "The Amazing Mr. X".

4.title: The Devil Bat
4.plot: This episode features 1940's "The Devil Bat" and special guest Ron George, who will be doing a zombie makeup demo throughout the show.

6.title: Nosferatu
6.plot: This episode features 1922's "Nosferatu" and 1896's "The Haunted Castle".

7.title: Tormented
7.plot: This episode features the 1960 ghost movie "Tormented".

8.title: Man in the Attic
8.plot: This episode features 1953's thriller "Man in the Attic".

9.title: The Mad Magician
9.plot: Features 1954's "The Mad Magician" and a special on The 2015 International Horror Hotel.

11.title: Funeral Home
11.plot: Lamia talks about 1980's "Funeral Home" before showing the movie.

12.title: I Bury the Living
12.plot: Features 1958's "I Bury the Living" and an interview with filmmaker Thomas Ryan.

14.title: Creature of Destruction
14.plot: This episode features 1967's "Creature of Destruction" and an interview with Skippy The Evil Clown.

15.title: The Little Shop of Horrors
15.plot: This episode features 1960's "The Little Shop of Horrors" and an interview with filmmakers Kyle Chappell and Lari Teras, talking about their horror-comedy "Blood Riders: The Devil Rides with Us".

16.title: Horrors of Spider Island
16.plot: Features "Horrors of Spider Island" and footage from The 2015 International Horror Hotel's Scream Queen competition.

imdb.plot outline: Do you love all things dark and disturbing? In the vein of Elvira, Horror Hotel features the new queen of the night, Lamia (Lay-me-uh), who will bring you the best horror movies you have yet to see. From independent horror films to classic black and whites, you'll find out more about the movies, the people involved in making them and all of their horrifying stories.
imdb.title: Horror Hotel
plot: Do you love all things dark and disturbing? In the vein of Elvira, _Horror Hotel_ (qv) features the new queen of the night, Lamia (Lay-me-uh), who will bring you the best horror movies you have yet to see. From independent horror films to classic black and whites, you'll find out more about the movies, the people involved in making them and all of their horrifying stories.::Reel TV Network
